content.description: Fun wandering route up nice textured rock with some exposure to 2-bolt chain and rappel-ring anchor.  Can place a piece of gear prior to first bolt, though pretty easy terrain up a ramp to climbers right to a bulge, then move back left to arete/face. Due to sharp edges lead rope will encounter it may be best to belay the second up and rappel down from the nice ledge at the anchor.  Do need to descend or rappel to climbers left back to base of climb as natural fall line drops off a good bit on the right and might challenge rope length and would land you in a tree.
content.protection: 3 bolts and chain anchor with rappel-rings.  Can place a piece of gear prior to first bolt (easy terrain, but ground drops off below you as you scramble up a ramp).
content.location: On the right most buttress with a bolt line (first buttress you see as you make your way up to the upper tier).

content.description: Start up the buttress and connect the dots.
content.location: Currently the left-most bolted line on the upper tier

content.description: Sunny most of day, some climbs between buttresses might be shaded.  Generally SE exposure.
